translation: seventeen

source_sentence: 入王宮門學處第八十二之四
translation: Entering the King's Palace and Training Place 82-4

source_sentence: 爾時薄伽梵在王舍城竹林園中。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān was in the bamboo grove of the city of Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 時有南方壯士，力敵千夫，來至此城詣影勝王所，自言勇健弓馬無雙。
translation: A brave man from the south, outmatched by a thousand men, came to this city and visited King Jingshan, saying that he was brave and had an unsurpassed bow and horse.

source_sentence: 王見歡喜加之重祿，授其大將。
translation: The king was delighted and gave him a great reward, awarding him the rank of general.

source_sentence: 時摩揭陀憍薩羅二國中間大曠野處，有五百群賊殺害商旅，由斯兩界人行路絕。
translation: At the time, in the great wilderness between the two countries of Magadha and Kośala, there were five hundred bandits who killed merchants and cut off the paths of people traveling between those two realms.

source_sentence: 時影勝王聞是事已命大將曰：「卿可往彼二國中間曠野之處屏除群賊，權住於彼。」
translation: After hearing about this, King Jingsheng ordered the commander, "Sir, you may go to that wilderness between the two countries and rid it of the bandits, and you have the right to stay there."

source_sentence: 時彼大將奉王教已，將諸左右往曠野中，見彼群賊將便獨進，鋒矢交刃射一百人。
translation: After he had been instructed by the king, the commander sent his men out into the wilderness and saw the bandits advancing alone, firing a spear and crossbow at a hundred men.

source_sentence: 餘四百人尚來共戰，其將告曰：「汝等莫前，勿令俱死，宜釋甲仗，去傷者箭觀其活不？」
translation: When the remaining 400 men still came to fight together, the general told them, "Don't go forward, for you mustn't all die; it's better to release your armor and weapons, remove the wounded, and see if they're alive."

source_sentence: 諸賊聞已看被射者，為去其箭尋並命終，方知大將善閑射法，更不敢戰，餘四百人求哀請活。
translation: After the thieves heard this, they looked at those who had been shot and looked for their arrows to be removed and their lives ended. They then realized that the general was a good marksman and didn't dare to fight, and the remaining 400 begged for mercy and asked to be allowed to live.

source_sentence: 大將愍之慈心向彼，即於二界築一新城，總集諸人共住於此，從斯已後名曠野城。
translation: The general was kind enough to look out for them, so he built a new city in two realms and gathered the people there to live together, and from then on it was called the city of Kōkaku.

source_sentence: 時此城人眾共立制，若有嫁娶皆延大將先令食已，方為歡讌。
translation: The people of this city then established a common rule that if there was a marriage, they would invite the general to give them food before they could have a joyful time together.

source_sentence: 時有一人家極貧窶，欲為婚娶無容辦食以命大將，即自思念：「我貧無力請大將來，今此新妻身未相觸，宜當進奉以表素心。」
translation: Then, there was a man whose family was extremely poor and couldn't afford to feed the general for his wedding.

source_sentence: 便令其妻入將軍室方始歸家，從此已後城內諸人以此為式。
translation: He then had his wife enter the general's quarters before he returned home, and from then on, the people of the city took that as their model.

source_sentence: 時有女子欲為婚娶便作是念：「此城諸人久行非法，自娉妻室先與他人，欲作何緣能絕斯事？」
translation: A woman who wanted to marry then thought, "These people have been acting unlawfully for a long time, and they've given their wives and homes to others before them; what reason do you have to stop this?"

source_sentence: 便於晝日眾人聚處裸立小便，諸人見已皆叱之曰：「汝是童女理合羞慚，何故對眾人前作非禮事？」
translation: They then urinated naked in a crowded place during the day, and when they saw them, they all scolded them, saying, "You're a girl who should be ashamed; why are you doing something rude in front of everyone?"

source_sentence: 女子報曰：「若對丈夫可有羞恥，對諸婦女何所羞慚？」
translation: The woman replied, "If there's shame in being honest with your husband, what shame is there in being honest with women?"

source_sentence: 諸人對曰：「我非丈夫耶？」
translation: The people replied, "Aren't I a husband?"

source_sentence: 女子報曰：「若是丈夫者豈有自娶己妻先令他犯！」
translation: The woman replied, "If you're a husband, how could you have taken your own wife and caused another to violate her?"

source_sentence: 諸人聞已各起深慚，即便共議：「我等可詳殺其大將。」
translation: After they heard that, they each felt a deep sense of shame, and they all agreed, "We could have killed his general in detail."

source_sentence: 伺彼入池洗浴之際，諸人總集以劍刺之，彼欲命終即便念曰：「非我本意汝自樂為，今實無辜枉斷我命。」
translation: As they waited for him to enter the pond to bathe, they all gathered together and stabbed him with their swords. Even as he was about to die, he thought, "I didn't intend for you to do it yourself, but now you really did cut off my life in vain."

source_sentence: 遂發邪願：「願我捨此身後生暴惡藥叉，食此城中所有男女。」
translation: He then makes a wrong vow, "May I abandon this body and be born a violent yakṣa who eats all the men and women in this city."

source_sentence: 發是願已尋即命終，受藥叉身於此曠野叢林中住。
translation: Immediately after making that vow, he found himself at death's door and was reborn as a yakṣa in this wild forest.

source_sentence: 由其前身怨讎業故，於此城中作大災害人多病死。
translation: As a result of their predecessors' grudges and karma, great misfortune befell this city, and people died of illness.

source_sentence: 諸人知已皆往林中懺謝前過，請於每日常輸一人以充彼食。
translation: After they learn this, they all go to the forest to repent for their past mistakes and ask that one person from each day be given food to eat.

source_sentence: 凡次死者於其門上懸牓告知，或家主自行、或遣男女充其飲食。
translation: Whenever the next person dies, a sign is hung over their door informing them that either the head of the household himself or a man or woman has been sent to provide them with food and drink.

source_sentence: 時有長者，於百神所求得一子，初誕之時門上見牓，其婦憂愁懷抱嬰孩悲啼而住。
translation: An elderly man who had sought a son from one of the hundred gods saw a sign on his door when he was first born, and the woman was sad and embraced the baby, lamenting.

source_sentence: 夫從外來見牓而進，知婦憂苦報其婦曰：「業屬如此事當奈何？
translation: When the husband comes from outside and sees the sign, he enters, knowing the woman's distress and suffering, and tells her, "What should I do if this is my business?

source_sentence: 汝不須憂，勿生愛戀，宜將兒子送與藥叉。」
translation: Don't be concerned; don't get attached; it's better to give your son to Yakṣa."

source_sentence: 作是語已抱其孩子送至林處，夫妻還歸昇高樓上，四方觀察慇懃敬禮說伽他曰：「靈祇遍滿於世間，　　自伏諸根能濟物；　我為孩子求哀禮，　　願見慈悲相救護。」
translation: After saying these words, he took the child and sent him off to the forest, where the couple returned and ascended to a high building, looked around, paid respectful homage, and spoke to the buddha, saying, "Lingir is pervasive in the world, subduing his own faculties and being able to help things; I beg for pity and respect for my child, and may I see compassion and protect him."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊常以佛眼觀察眾生，如餘廣說，乃至如母牛隨犢。
translation: The Bhagavān then always observed sentient beings with the Buddha's eye, explaining as much as the others, even as a mother cow following a calf.

source_sentence: 佛為憐愍長者妻子，及曠野城中諸男女故，知此城中堪受教化，漸次遊行至曠野處，為暴惡藥叉說微妙法令生淨信，為受三歸及五學處，乃至藥叉說頌請曰：「云何丈夫最勝財？
translation: For the pity of the elder's wife and the sons and daughters of the desert city, the Buddha knew that the city was worthy of instruction, so he gradually traveled to the desert region, taught the violent Yakṣa a subtle teaching that would lead to pure faith, and accepted the three refuges and five abodes of training, even as Yakṣa spoke a verse inviting him, "What is the most excellent possession of a husband?

source_sentence: 云何修行能利樂？
translation: How can cultivation bring benefit?

source_sentence: 云何味中為第一？
translation: "What is the best of flavors?

source_sentence: 云何命中為最勝？」
translation: What is the most excellent of lives?"

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「信為丈夫最勝財，　　善法常修能利樂，　諸味之中實語最，　　於諸命中慧為勝。」
translation: The Bhagavān told him, "Faith is a husband's greatest asset, a constant cultivator of good qualities that bring benefit and joy, the most true speech among flavors, and wisdom that excels among lives."

source_sentence: 藥叉請曰：「云何足珍財？
translation: Yakṣa asked, "What is the wealth that's precious?

source_sentence: 云何有名稱？
translation: What is called name?

source_sentence: 云何人所敬？
translation: What kind of person does it honor?

source_sentence: 云何善友增？」
translation: How do we increase the number of good friends?"

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「好施足珍財，　　持戒有名稱，　實語人所敬，　　無慳善友增。」
translation: The Bhagavān told him, "A good donor has enough treasures, observes precepts that are praiseworthy, speaks truly, and is respected by people, and has no stinginess or good friends."

source_sentence: 藥叉請曰：「世間由幾生？
translation: Yakṣa asked, "How many lifetimes does the world take?

source_sentence: 由幾得名稱？
translation: How did it get its name?

source_sentence: 由幾能成立？
translation: For what reason can this be established?

source_sentence: 由幾能衰損？」
translation: By how much can it be impaired?"

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「世間由六生，　　由六得名稱，　由六能成立，　　由六能衰損。」
translation: The Bhagavān told him, "It's from the six that the world is born, from the six that it gets its name, from the six that it can establish, and from the six that it can decay."

source_sentence: 藥叉請曰：「云何離愚癡，　　晝夜無羈絆，　能於緣不住，　　不怖於深坑？」
translation: Yakṣa asked, "How can you be free of folly, have no restraints day and night, abide in conditions, and not fear the deepest pit?"

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「定慧離愚癡，　　捨著無羈絆，　於境緣不住，　　持戒越深坑。」
translation: The Bhagavān told him, "Concentration and wisdom are free of folly, abandoning attachment and no bondage, abiding in objective conditions and upholding precepts that transcend deep pits."

source_sentence: 藥叉請曰：「誰能渡瀑流？
translation: Bhaiṣajya asked, "Who can cross the raging current?

source_sentence: 誰能越大海？
translation: Who can cross the ocean?

source_sentence: 誰能離諸苦？
translation: Who can be free from suffering?

source_sentence: 誰得心清淨？」
translation: Who has attained mental purity?"

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「信能渡瀑流，　　謹慎越大海；　精勤離諸苦，　　有慧心清淨。
translation: The Bhagavān told them, "Faith can cross the raging current, and prudence crosses the ocean; diligence parts with suffering, and having wisdom purifies the mind.

source_sentence: 汝今咸可問，　　沙門婆羅門，　離實語布施，　　更有勝法不？」
translation: Now, you can all ask, 'Is there anything superior to the ascetic or brāhmaṇa who doesn't give alms in truth?'"

source_sentence: 藥叉答曰：「我今何假問，　　沙門婆羅門？
translation: Yakṣa replied, "Why do I presume to ask, śramaṇa brāhmaṇa?

source_sentence: 世尊大智海，　　能說真妙法。
translation: "The Bhagavān is a great ocean of wisdom, capable of teaching the truly wonderful Dharma.

source_sentence: 我從今日後，　　遊履於人間，　常禮佛世尊，　　敬重於正法。
translation: From now on, I'll wander among humans, always paying homage to the Bhagavān and honoring the right teaching.

source_sentence: 世尊大慈愍，　　降臨我住處；　我今決定知，　　當盡生死際。」
translation: The Bhagavān has great compassion, coming to my dwelling place; now I'm certain I'll know that I'll end birth and death."

source_sentence: 爾時藥叉持此童子奉上世尊，世尊受已授與父母，即說頌曰：「蜜跡手授我，　　我手授父母；　由手相傳故，　　應名曠野手。」
translation: Yakṣa then took this child and presented it to the Bhagavān, who accepted it and gave it to his parents. He then spoke a verse, "Honey trails gave me his hand, and my hand gave it to my parents; because it's passed from hand to hand, it should be called a wild hand."

source_sentence: 孩兒因此名曠野手，年漸長大。
translation: The boy was thus named Kuang Nyi Hands, and he grew older.

source_sentence: 時曠野城未有君主，眾人共議，此曠野手童子有大福德，親蒙世尊之所護念：「我等宜可策以為王。」
translation: At the time, there was no ruler in Kuang Ngao, and the people agreed that this boy Kuang Ngao Hands had great merit and was personally guarded by the Bhagavān, saying, "It would be good for us to be made king."

source_sentence: 爾時世羅苾芻尼，從勝音城將除患大臣女名曰紺容付，與妙音長者令其養育，年既長成儀容端正，眾所愛敬國內無雙。
translation: It was then that the Bhikṣuṇī Śīlabhadra took the minister for the removal of suffering's daughter named Kanyon and gave her to the elder Miaoyin to raise, and when she had grown up she had a fine appearance that was loved and respected by everyone and was unequalled in the country.

source_sentence: 時摩揭陀國影勝大王、憍薩羅國勝光大王、憍閃毘國明勝大王，及廣嚴城栗姑毘等，并餘貴族咸齎信物各遣使人，來就妙音求紺容女。
translation: It was then that the great king Yingshang of Magadha, the great king Jingshang of Kośala, the great king Jingshang of Kauśāmbī, and the other noble people of Vaiśravaṇa sent messengers with gifts to Myōon to ask for the daughter of Kanyō.

source_sentence: 長者愁惱作如是念：「來求女者多是國王，我若不與皆生怨恨容害於我。」
translation: The elder was distressed and thought, "Many of the people who come to ask for a woman are kings, and if I don't give them a hand, they'll become resentful and harm me."

source_sentence: 報紺容曰：「今隨汝情，堪為偶對，可自選取。」
translation: In response, he said, "Now, according to your inclinations, you can choose a suitable match."

source_sentence: 時諸王使并餘貴族不期而會，於妙音長者花園中住。
translation: The king's envoys and the other nobles met unexpectedly and stayed in the garden of Elder Sumeru.

source_sentence: 時彼長者即以種種上妙衣服無價珠瓔，莊飾紺容令乘大象，手執花鬘往眾人處：「汝所愛樂堪為夫者，當以此花擲彼身上。」
translation: That elder then adorned his beautiful appearance with a variety of fine clothing, priceless jewelry, and adorned him with a large elephant and carried a flower garland in his hand to the crowd, saying, "Those of you who would be pleasant to be with, you must throw this flower at them."

source_sentence: 紺容即便詣眾人所問言：「曠野手王住在何處？」
translation: He then went to the people and asked, "Where does the wilderness hand king live?"

source_sentence: 眾人指示，女即以花望彼而擲，作如是語：「佛於藥叉手中所受童子，當為我夫。」
translation: When the crowd instructed her, the woman tossed a flower at them and said, "The boy whom the Buddha accepted in Yakṣa's hand will be my husband."

source_sentence: 諸人聞已咸皆四散。
translation: After the people heard this, they all scattered.

source_sentence: 妙音長者知女意至，即為嚴整上妙象馬僕使車乘，種種衣服飾以珠瓔，禮送紺容往曠野處，夜闇門閉無由得入，權居門下假寐通宵。
translation: Knowing the woman's intention, the elder Miaoyin knew she was there, so she fixed up a chariot of fine elephants, horses, servants, and various kinds of clothing adorned with beads and diadem, and escorted her to a deserted place where her vajra was closed at night and there was no way to enter, so she stayed under the gate and slept through the night.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊觀見曠野手堪應受化，乃至廣說，若曠野手與紺容相會者，染愛纏縛於生死中未能出離，無階聖果。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān observed that the wilderness hand was fit to be transformed, and he explained in detail that if the wilderness hand had met with Kanyong, he would be tethered by defiled love, unable to escape from birth-and-death, and without any stage to the noble fruit.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊知是事已，即從王舍往曠野城，至彼城隅日光遂沒，即於其夜臥牛跡搶地。
translation: Knowing this, the Bhagavān went from the royal abode to the city of Kuang Nyi, and when he reached the city's border, the sunlight disappeared, and he spent the night lying on a cow track scrambling the ground.

source_sentence: 時曠野手聞佛世尊來至城外臥牛跡搶中，天既曉已，時曠野手欲禮世尊出城門下，見紺容女車馬僕從。
translation: When the Khandaka heard that the Bhagavān had arrived outside the city and was lying in the midst of the cattle trails, at dawn the Khandaka wanted to pay homage to the Bhagavān and go out from the city gates, but he saw a vaguely shaped woman with a chariot and horses and attendants.

source_sentence: 問：「是誰女宿此城門？」
translation: He asked, "Who is this woman staying at the city gates?"

source_sentence: 時紺容女具以來意答曠野手，王聞是事令往宮中。
translation: When the purple-skinned woman fully answered the wild hand, the king heard about it and ordered her to go to the palace.

source_sentence: 時王詣佛所稽首白言：「世尊！
translation: The king then went to the Buddha, prostrated himself, and said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 不審大師宿在荒田得安隱不？」
translation: I wonder if the great master found comfort in staying in a deserted field?"

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「曠野手！
translation: The Bhagavān told them, "Kōyakushō!

source_sentence: 於此世間得安隱眠者我為第一。」
translation: I'm the best among those who attain peaceful sleep in this world."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊說伽他曰：「能除於罪惡，　　不被欲所繫；　離染歸圓寂，　　彼得安隱眠。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān spoke to Gatha, saying, "He's able to remove sins and evil, isn't tied down by desire, and returns to perfect tranquility free of defilement, so he can sleep soundly.

source_sentence: 能除熱惱病，　　一切希望斷；　其心常寂靜，　　彼得安隱眠。」
translation: He removes feverish illnesses and stops all hopes, and his mind is always still, so he can sleep soundly."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊，為曠野手種種說法示教利喜，即於座上證不還果，廣說如《阿笈摩經》。
translation: The Bhagavān then, explaining the various teachings to the wilderness handlers, showed them how to benefit and delight them, then realized the fruit of nonreturning while sitting on his seat and spoke extensively about it, such as the Āgama-sūtra.

source_sentence: 禮佛足已從座而去，既還宮已語紺容曰：「我捨諸欲更不耽樂，汝雖來至，隨意去住無人遮止。」
translation: After bowing his head to the Buddha's feet, he departed from his seat and returned to the palace. He said to Kanyong, "I abandoned my desires and didn't want to indulge in any more pleasures, but even though you've come and gone, you can go and stay as you like without being stopped by anyone."

source_sentence: 紺容曰：「我樂住此，願與佛子為給侍人。」
translation: He said, "I'm happy to stay here, and I'd like to be assisted by the Buddha's son."

source_sentence: 時曠野手為佛及僧，於此城外造僧住處，四事供養無所闕少，廣說乃至曠野手王遇疾而死，生無熱天，既起三心，來詣佛所禮足而坐。
translation: Kōyasena then built a residence for the saṃgha outside this city for the Buddha and the saṃgha, making no shortage of offerings in four ways. It was widely explained that even when King Kōyasena was stricken with illness and died, he was born in the Saṃgha Heaven.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「汝曠野手因何業故生無熱天？」
translation: The Bhagavān told him, "What was the cause of your actions, Kaṇṭhaka, that led to your birth in the Saṃgha Heaven?"

source_sentence: 即以伽他答世尊曰：「我由見世尊，　　及得聞正法，　供養於僧眾，　　曾無厭足心。
translation: He answered the Bhagavān with a reply, "Because I've seen the Bhagavān, heard the right teaching, and made offerings to the saṃgha, I've never had a disillusioned mind.

source_sentence: 受行勝人法，　　遠離於貪愛，　於三事常修，　　故我生無熱。」
translation: I've accepted and practiced the teachings of superior people, stayed away from craving, and always cultivated the three things, so I've had no cravings."

source_sentence: 時曠野手天子，頂禮佛足忽然不現。
translation: The wild-armed god then bowed his head at the Buddha's feet and suddenly didn't appear.

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻夜見光耀咸皆有疑，曉請世尊曰：「彼曠野手，曾作何業纔見紺容，從斯已後得不還果？」
translation: When the monks saw the radiance shining brightly at night, they all had doubts and asked the Bhagavān, "What was that wild hand that once did something to get a rare glimpse of his venerable face, and since then has he attained the fruit of nonreturn?"

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「汝等應聽！
translation: The Buddha addressed the monks, "All of you should listen!

source_sentence: 乃往古昔有大臣子，兄弟二人住居林野，大名手足網鞔、小名無網鞔。
translation: It was once upon a time that there were two brothers, a minister and a son, who lived in a forest, and the elder was called "Manojña," and the younger was called "Manojña without Nets.

source_sentence: 大者修得五通，小者就師受學。
translation: The older one cultivated the five supernormal powers, and the younger one studied with a teacher.

source_sentence: 其師有女名曰妙容，顏貌端嚴。
translation: Their teacher had a daughter named Myōryō with a beautiful face.

source_sentence: 年漸長大情希出適，至學生所作如是語：『父母令我與汝為妻。』
translation: When she grew older and desired to go out, she said to her student, 'My parents want me to take you as my wife.'

source_sentence: 彼聞不許，其女遂瞋。
translation: When he heard that, he didn't permit it, and the girl became angry.

source_sentence: 學生恐怖即便逃走，女尋趁及邀遣為夫。
translation: The student was terrified and ran away, but the woman took advantage of it and invited him to take her as her husband.

source_sentence: 學生固守不隨所願，女便執刀欲斬其首。
translation: When the student resisted and didn't follow his wish, the woman took a knife and wanted to chop off his head.

source_sentence: 爾時學生知不免難，即便合掌作如是說：『南謨大仙，網鞔手足。』
translation: Knowing that he wouldn't be spared, the student joined his palms and said, 'Namo, great sage, these are my hands and feet.'

source_sentence: 纔歸命已仙人應至，即便携去共至山林，於牛跡搶處令其出家，教修勝法證得五通。
translation: After he had barely returned to life, the sage answered, took him away to a mountain forest, made him leave home by snatching cattle from their tracks, and taught him to cultivate the excellent qualities and realize the five supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 往時大兄五通仙者即我身是，彼小弟者即曠野手是，彼妙容者即紺容是。
translation: "In the past, my oldest brother, the sage of the five powers, was my body, his younger brother was Kōyasu's hand, and his beautiful face was my face.

source_sentence: 我於往昔見將被害携至山林，令得五通離女怨對。
translation: In the past, I saw someone about to be harmed, took them to the mountains, and made them attain the five powers and leave the woman's enemies.

source_sentence: 我於今日還令免彼紺容所逼，於生死海得永出離。
translation: Now, I've also caused him to be spared the oppression of that vulture and to attain permanent escape from the ocean of birth-and-death.

source_sentence: 是故汝等於有漏中速求捨離。」
translation: Therefore, you must quickly seek escape from the contaminants."

source_sentence: 爾時諸苾芻復有疑心，請世尊曰：「何因緣故此曠野手纔初生已，將與藥叉用充飲食，世尊至彼令免厄難？」
translation: Those monks then again had doubts and asked the Bhagavān, "What was the reason why the Bhagavān went to that wild hand that had just been born and was about to give him a yakṣa to fill his diet, and he saved him from that misfortune?"

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「汝等善聽！
translation: The Buddha addressed the monks, "All of you, listen well!

source_sentence: 當為汝說。
translation: I will explain it for you.

source_sentence: 乃往過去於一城中王好食肉，時有一人欲求於王以雞奉獻，王得雞已將付厨人令充羹臛。
translation: Once upon a time, there was a man in a city where the king liked to eat meat, and he wanted to ask the king to sacrifice a chicken, so the king got the chicken and sent it to a cook to make it into a meal.

source_sentence: 彼獻雞者素有悲心，便作是念：『我今不應進奉活雞令彼屠割。』
translation: The person who offered the chicken had a long history of compassion, so he thought, 'Now, I shouldn't offer a live chicken for him to slaughter.'

source_sentence: 即持倍價就厨人所求贖而放，遂便生念：『此雞無辜，緣我進獻幾將被殺，此之惡業願勿受報。
translation: He then asked the cook for redemption and released it with double the price, and then he thought, 'This chicken is innocent, and because I offered it to it and was about to be killed, I hope I won't be rewarded for this bad action.

source_sentence: 我復贖放所有福業，令我來世遭厄難時，得勝大師來相救濟。』
translation: I'll redeem all the good deeds I've done, so that when I'm in trouble in the next life, I'll be rescued by a great teacher.'

source_sentence: 汝等知不？
translation: Do you know that?

source_sentence: 往時獻雞者即曠野手是，由昔願力今免厄難，如是應知。」
translation: That's the man who offered the fowl, Kōyasu, and it was because of his past vows that he was spared trouble now, as you should know."

source_sentence: 爾時曠野手身亡之後，紺容還向憍閃毘妙音長者家。
translation: It was then that Kōyasu returned to the home of Elder Marvelous Sound of Kauśāmbī after Kōyasu's death.

source_sentence: 時憍閃毘主鄔陀延王，聞紺容女未被男觸還來本家，便問大臣妙音共為禮娶，置妙花樓侍女千人令無闕乏，每於日日與金錢一千。
translation: When King Udayan, the lord of Kauśāmbī, heard that she had returned to his house before being touched by a man, he asked his minister Miaoyin to honor and marry her, and he gave her a thousand attendants from Miaofarou so that there would be no shortage, and he gave her a thousand coins every day.

source_sentence: 其侍人內有女曲脊，因以為名。
translation: Among those attendants was a woman named Quqi, which was why she was named that.

source_sentence: 時曲脊女於日日中，常以千錢買香供給，於香店處共賣香男子密媾私情，將五百錢以充食直，餘有五百買香而歸。
translation: Every day, she would buy a thousand coins of incense for an offering. She would have an affair with a man who sold incense at a perfume shop, giving 500 coins to feed herself and the other 500 to buy incense and return.

source_sentence: 後於異時共賣香男子同心設供，請佛及僧，廣說乃至食已聽法。
translation: At another time, they made offerings together with the man selling the incense, invited the Buddha and the saṃgha, and explained the teaching in detail up to the point where they had eaten and listened to the teaching.

source_sentence: 既聞法已，即於座上俱獲初果。
translation: After hearing the Dharma, they were both present at the seat and attained the first realization.

source_sentence: 既見諦理即便實用千錢買香持還宮內。
translation: Seeing the principle, they bought a thousand coins worth of incense and returned it to the palace.

source_sentence: 紺容夫人見彼塗香多於餘日，便問其故。
translation: Seeing how much more incense they applied than the other day, the monk's wife asked her about the reason.

source_sentence: 彼曲脊女皆以前事具實白知，是時紺容見其希有，告侍女曰：「我身有難無容輒出，汝可日日往世尊所，聽妙法已來為我說。」
translation: She told her maid that she knew exactly what had happened before, and then she saw how rare it was and told her maid, "I have a problem that I can't easily escape from, so go to the Bhagavān day by day and listen to the wonderful teaching that he'll explain to me."

source_sentence: 彼即往聽還至宮中，紺容夫人自居勝座令彼說法。
translation: She went, listened, and returned to the palace, where Lady Kanyong took her own distinguished seat and told her to teach the Dharma.

source_sentence: 曲脊告曰：「聽法之儀不應如此。」
translation: She told him, "This is not the proper way to listen to the teaching."

source_sentence: 夫人知已為敷勝座，自居卑下請其說法，既聞妙法證不還果。
translation: Knowing this, the lady spread out her seat of honor, made herself subservient, and asked her to preach the Dharma.

source_sentence: 時有外道婆羅門是磨沙國人名曰無憂，婦名舍利。
translation: Then, there was a non-Buddhist Brāhmaṇa from the country of Moṣa named Wuzu and a woman named Śāri.

source_sentence: 後生一女，色貌端嚴人所愛樂，因名無比。
translation: She later gave birth to a daughter whose appearance was so dignified that she was loved by people, and she was therefore named Wubi.

source_sentence: 年漸長大自作是念：「若人與我容儀相似者，當與為妻。」
translation: As she grew older, she thought to herself, "If someone resembles my appearance, I will give them to you as a wife."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊到憍閃毘次行乞還本處，飯食訖住閑林中。
translation: The Bhagavān then went to Kauśāmbīji, returned to his home base on a mission, and stayed in a quiet forest after he had eaten.

source_sentence: 時無憂外道來至佛所，觀佛容儀無能比者遂作是念：「今此丈夫儀容殊特，得與我女為婚對者，豈不樂哉。」
translation: Then, a non-Buddhist without sorrow came to the Buddha and observed that there was no match for the Buddha's appearance. He then thought, "Now, wouldn't it be nice if this man with exceptional features could be my daughter's wife?"

source_sentence: 外道還家告其妻曰：「我女得夫儀容相似，可具瓔珞共為婚娶。」
translation: The non-Buddhist returned home and told his wife, "My daughter has a husband with similar features, so she can wear a necklace and marry him."

source_sentence: 婦便問曰：「彼是何人？」
translation: The woman then asked, "Who is he?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「是沙門喬答摩。」
translation: He replied, "It's the ascetic Gautama."

source_sentence: 婦聞語已說伽他曰：「我曾於國中，　　見大仙乞食，　行於不平地，　　隨彼足高低，　如斯之大人，　　豈念於妻子？」
translation: After hearing this, the woman said to him, "I once saw a great sage begging for food in my country, walking on uneven ground and following his feet's height. Would such a great man think of his wife?"

source_sentence: 時無憂婆羅門聞斯語已瞋而告曰：「舍利非善徵，　　吉祥言惡相；　縱彼心精進，　　有大威神力；　若見無比女，　　便生愛樂心。」
translation: When the Brahmin Aśoka heard this, he spoke angrily and told her, "Śāriputra is not a good symbol, and he speaks auspiciously of bad appearances; even though his mind is diligent, he has great authority and power; if he sees a woman without peer, he'll become delighted with her."

source_sentence: 作是語已，便以妙衣諸瓔珞具莊嚴其女，父母隨從送向佛所，便於路中見佛足跡千輻輪相，無憂見已報其婦曰：「此是女夫行處。」
translation: After he said this, he adorned his daughter with fine clothing and jewelry, and her parents accompanied her to the Buddha's place.

source_sentence: 舍利觀見佛跡端嚴，以頌報曰：「染欲之人跡不正，　　急性多瞋踏地堅；　愚癡者跡不分明，　　此是離欲人行處。
translation: Śāriputra observed the Buddha's [footprints] in full splendor and reported with a verse, "A person with defiled desires doesn't have correct footprints, and their impulsiveness and anger tread firmly on the ground; a foolish person's footprints aren't clearly delineated; this is the place where someone who's free of desire walks.

source_sentence: 「我觀是相，定非無比對偶之人。」
translation: "I've observed these features, and I'm sure they aren't those of an incomparable match."

source_sentence: 無憂重說初頌報曰：「舍利非善徵，　　吉祥言惡相；　縱彼千輻具，　　有大威神力；　若見無比女，　　便生愛樂心。」
translation: Aśoka repeats the first verse, "Śāriputra is not a good symbol, and he speaks of bad appearances auspiciously; even though he has a thousand-spoked body with great authority and power, if he sees an incomparable woman, he'll become delighted."

source_sentence: 次復前行，見佛世尊臥草褥處，報其婦曰：「此是女夫所臥草褥。」
translation: He then went on to see the Bhagavān lying on a straw mattress and reported to her wife, "This is the straw mattress where her husband lies."

source_sentence: 舍利觀見草褥不亂，報曰：「染欲人臥多穿穴，　　瞋者臥處草敷堅；　愚癡人臥草縱橫，　　此是離欲人眠處。
translation: Śāriputra observed that the straw mattress wasn't in disarray and reported, "A person with defiled desires lies down in a lot of holes, an angry person lies down in a place where the straw is solid, and a foolish person lies down in a place where the straw is tangled, but this is where a person free of desires sleeps.

source_sentence: 「我觀是相，定非女夫之所眠處，宜當旋踵共還故居。」
translation: "When I observe this, I'm sure it's not a woman's husband's sleeping place, so I suggest you turn around and return to your old home together."

source_sentence: 無憂重忿報曰：「舍利非善徵，　　吉祥言惡相；　縱彼草不亂，　　有大威神力；　若見無比女，　　便生愛樂心。」
translation: Amitâbha was severely indignant and replied, "Śāriputra is not a good symbol, and he speaks of bad appearances; even though his grass isn't disturbed, he has great authority and strength; if he sees an incomparable woman, he'll become delighted."

source_sentence: 作是語已便共相將往至佛所，無憂即便說伽他曰：「仁當觀此女，　　美貌具莊嚴；　須妻我見授，　　顏容妙相似；　猶如十五夜，　　星月共相輝。」
translation: After saying this, they all went to the Buddha, and even after Aśoka spoke to him, "Sir, you must examine this woman, for she's beautiful and adorned. I've seen her given by Suzuki, and she has a wonderfully similar face. She's like the fifteenth night when the stars and moon shine together."

source_sentence: 世尊聞已便作是念：「若我與此無比女人作慈愍言者，此女必當別我去時，情生顧戀因此命終。
translation: After hearing this, the Bhagavān then had this thought, "If I were to speak compassionately to this incomparable woman, she would surely part with me when I leave and become attached to her, and her life would end as a result.

source_sentence: 我今宜應現瞋忿相共其父語。」
translation: Now, I should show my anger and talk to her father."

source_sentence: 作是念已即向無憂說伽他曰：「魔王奉三女，　　端正世無雙，　瓔珞盛莊嚴，　　我不生欲意。
translation: After he thought this, he told Aśoka, "The Māra King serves three women who are unsurpassed in the world in terms of their beauty and adorned with jewelry, but I don't get desires for them.

source_sentence: 況此卑賤身，　　不淨遍充滿，　令我足指近，　　亦無如是事。」
translation: Even if this lowly body were filled with impurities, there wouldn't be anything like it that would cause my feet to point near them."

source_sentence: 時無比女聞是語已心生忿惱，觀父低頭，于時無憂瞻仰尊顏而說頌曰：「我女容華盛，　　端嚴無與比；　仁今何所為，　　無心相愛念？」
translation: After hearing those words, the Bhagavān became angry, looked down at her father, looked up at his venerable face without sorrow, and spoke in verse, "My daughter is gorgeous and beautiful, unsurpassed in dignity; what do you do now, sir, that you don't think about her?"

source_sentence: 世尊報曰：「世間愚癡人，　　於境生愛著；　若觀斯美女，　　遂使心迷倒。
translation: The Bhagavān replied, "A foolish man in the world becomes attached to objects, and if he were to look at this beautiful woman, it would cause his mind to be misdirected.

source_sentence: 我是第七佛，　　獲得無上果；　如蓮出水中，　　不被欲塵污。」
translation: I am the seventh Buddha who has attained the unsurpassed result like a lotus emerging from the water and not being stained by the dust of desire."

source_sentence: 爾時無憂婆羅門及無比女，聞是語已捨佛而去。
translation: After hearing those words, the Brahmans and Peipei women abandoned the Buddha and departed.

source_sentence: 時有外道出家老苾芻，去佛不遠見無比女，便生染愛請世尊曰：「佛眼遍明朗，　　受斯無比女；　與我為妻室，　　隨情當受用。」
translation: Then, a layman or monk who had left home and seen Peerless' daughter not far from the Buddha became defiled and asked the Bhagavān, "The Buddha's eye is perfectly clear, so he accepted this Peerless' daughter as his wife and wife, and he will accept her according to his desire."

source_sentence: 佛聞此說默而不答。
translation: When the Buddha heard this, he was silent and didn't answer.

source_sentence: 時老苾芻染心逼故，復白佛言：「此是佛衣鉢，　　錫杖及君持，　并戒並相還，　　我今隨女去。」
translation: The old monk then, being overcome by defilement, again said to the Buddha, "This is the Buddha's robe and bowl, which he carries with his staff and his precepts, and I'll return it with the girl."

source_sentence: 彼老苾芻即棄衣鉢并捨學處，至無憂父所報言：「與我無比以充妻室。」
translation: The old monk then discarded his robe and bowl and left his place of study and went to his father at Wuzu and reported, "Give me nothing to fill my wife's household with."

source_sentence: 其父罵之嫌不與語，所願不遂便歐熱血因此命終。
translation: His father scolded him and didn't say anything, and when his wish wasn't granted, he bled out and died.

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻咸皆有疑，請世尊曰：「以何因緣將無比女奉上世尊，不為納受？」
translation: The monks then all had doubts and asked the Bhagavān, "For what reason did you present Mubi's daughter to the Bhagavān and not accept her?"

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「非無因緣！
translation: The Buddha addressed the monks, "Not without cause!

source_sentence: 汝等當聽。
translation: All of you should listen.

source_sentence: 乃往古昔有鍛師家，唯生一女，年雖長大恃自工巧不嫁與人。
translation: Once upon a time, there was a blacksmith's family who had only one daughter, and although she grew up, she relied on her skills and didn't marry anyone.

source_sentence: 然此鍛師能以鐵針一枚，置於水上而不沈沒。
translation: Still, this blacksmith could take an iron needle and place it on water without it sinking.

source_sentence: 時有婆羅門童子妙閑斯技，於一針穴投以七針，浮之水上亦不沈沒。
translation: Then, there was a Brahman boy who did a marvelous job of tossing seven needles into a needle hole, and they didn't sink when they were floated on water.

source_sentence: 時此童子欲伏鍛師，詣其門下唱言：『我有針賣，須者當取。』
translation: Desiring to subdue the forger, the boy went under his door and said, 'I have needles for sale; if you need them, you must take them.'

source_sentence: 女便出門笑而報曰：「『汝是愚癡人，　　或可無心識，　　今來鍛師舍，　　而云我賣針。』
translation: The woman then went out and smiled, saying, 'You're a foolish man, or perhaps you don't have the mental faculty to come to the blacksmith's house and say, 'I'm selling needles.'

source_sentence: 「童子亦笑答曰：「『賢首我非癡，　　不是無心識，　　欲定彼憍慢，　　詣此云賣針。
translation: "The boy also laughed and replied, "Good man, I'm not deluded. I'm not a mindless consciousness who wants to calm their arrogance and comes here saying I'm selling needles.

source_sentence: 汝父若知我，　　有斯勝技術，　　必以汝相娉，　　并家所有財。』
translation: If your father knew I had such excellent skills, he would have given you a contract and given you the family's wealth.'

source_sentence: 「于時鍛師聞是語已問童子曰：『汝之技術為實？
translation: "After hearing these words, the blacksmith asked the boy, 'Is your technique real?'

source_sentence: 為虛？』
translation: for nothing?"

source_sentence: 即自浮一針。
translation: That's when he floats one needle.

source_sentence: 彼便浮七。
translation: He then floats seven of them.

source_sentence: 於彼童子便生愛樂，遂許其女娉與為妻。
translation: The boy then became pleased with him and accepted his daughter as his wife.

source_sentence: 童子告曰：『我是婆羅門族姓高勝，豈鍛師種為伉儷耶？』
translation: The boy told him, 'I'm a Brahmin from a noble family, aren't I married to a lion's share?'

source_sentence: 捨之而去。
translation: They abandoned it and departed.

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 往時婆羅門者即我身是，鍛師者即無憂是，女者即無比是。
translation: "In the past, the brāhmaṇa was myself, the forger was Wuyu, and the woman was Mubi.

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 我於往時具足煩惱，尚棄其女，況今離欲為無上師而生貪染？
translation: I was fully afflicted in the past, and I still abandoned my daughter, so why would I want to be free of desire and become defiled by desire for an unsurpassed teacher now?

source_sentence: 如是應知。」
translation: You should know it this way."

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻復白佛言：「世尊！
translation: The monks then again said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 以何因緣老叟苾芻由無比女遂致命終？」
translation: For what reason did the old man and the monk end up with a deadly woman?"

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「汝等善聽！
translation: The Buddha addressed the monks, "All of you, listen well!

source_sentence: 此老苾芻，非但今日由無比故自取命終，乃往昔時亦相因故而致命終。
translation: This old monk didn't just take his own life today because of incomparability, but also in the past because of the causes that led to his death.

source_sentence: 於過去時有城，名師子劫。
translation: In the distant past, there was a city named Shizi-kalpa.

source_sentence: 王名師子頂，為大法王。
translation: The king's name was Shizi Teng, and he was the great king of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 時世豐樂人民熾盛，無諸怨爭干戈征罰、諂偽惡人共相侵害，亦無災橫及諸病苦，稻蔗牛羊在處充足，等觀兆庶猶如一子。
translation: In that time, the world was prosperous and the people flourished, there were no disputes, fierce fighting, punishments, flattery, or the association of unscrupulous people, no disasters or illnesses, and plenty of rice, cane, cattle, and sheep, and they looked equally at the multitudes as if they were a single child.

source_sentence: 時此城中有一商主名曰師子，大富多財受用豐足，所有珍貨及諸貲產，僮僕傭人無所闕乏，庫藏盈溢如毘沙門王，於同類族娶女為妻。
translation: At the time, there was a merchant in this city named Shizi who was wealthy and abundant in possessions and property, had precious goods and possessions, had no shortage of servants, and had an overflowing treasury like King Vaiśravaṇa.

source_sentence: 雖久共居竟無男女，為求子故祈禱神祇，遍諸天廟山林河沼，及同生天希望後嗣。
translation: Even though they've lived together for a long time, they have no sons or daughters, so they pray to gods and goddesses, pervade temples, mountains, forests, rivers, and marshes, and hope for an heir in the same heaven.

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 世人皆云由乞求故便獲子者，此誠虛妄。
translation: "People in the world say that a son is obtained by begging, but this is really false.

source_sentence: 斯若是實，人皆千子如轉輪王。
translation: If this were true, everyone would have a thousand sons like the wheel-turning king.

source_sentence: 然由三事方有子息：一者父母交會，二者其母身淨應合有娠，三者中有現前。
translation: However, there are three things that lead to the birth of a child: first, the union of father and mother, second, the mother's body is purified, and there's a pregnancy that should occur, and third, there's a present.

source_sentence: 商主與子業緣運會，時有一天從勝妙天下，應受貴位託蘊婦胎。
translation: When a merchant and his son meet for the purpose of karma, there's a day when they come from the most marvelous world and should be given the valuable position of being entrusted with the womb of a woman.

source_sentence: 若聰慧女人有五別智：一、知男子有染心無染心，二、知時節，三、知從彼人得，四、知是男，五、知是女。
translation: If a wise woman has five distinct kinds of knowledge, she'll know: 1. that a man has a defiled or undefiled mind, 2. that it's the right time, 3. that it's from that person, 4. that it's a man, and 5. that it's a woman.

source_sentence: 若是男者居在右脇，若是女者居在左脇。
translation: If it's a man, he'll stay at the right hypochondrium, and if it's a woman, she'll stay at the left hypochondrium.

source_sentence: 時彼人婦稟識聰慧，知胎居右喜告夫曰：『商主知不？
translation: When that woman, endowed with intelligence, knows that the fetus resides on the right side, she's delighted and tells her husband, 'Does the merchant know?'

source_sentence: 我所懷孕必是光顯宗族，現居右脇。
translation: 'My child must be from the Guangxian clan, which now resides on the right side.

source_sentence: 是男不疑。』
translation: This is a male, no doubt.'

source_sentence: 商主聞已即大慶喜作如是語：『我從久來常思繼嗣，願得善子紹我家業不墜宗門，我既長養終懷返報，廣為惠施福利親族。
translation: When the merchant heard this, he rejoiced greatly and said, 'Since long ago, I've always thought about an heir, wishing for a good son who would carry on my family's work and not fall out of the lineage, and now that I've nurtured him long enough to eventually carry his reward, I'll give generously to benefit my family.

source_sentence: 我沒世後稱憶我名而為呪願，願我所有尊祖父母，受生之處以福莊嚴。』
translation: After I pass away, I'll remember my name and recite this invocation, wishing that all my venerable ancestors and parents would be born in places adorned with good fortune.'

source_sentence: 即置其妻於妙樓觀縱意而住，隨時涼燠供給所須，常令女醫為調飲食，冷熱合度六味無差，所不宜者皆不令食。
translation: He then placed his wife in a wonderful mansion and observed her living in spite of her wishes, providing for her needs at all times in cool and warm weather and always having a doctor prepare a diet that matched hot and cold and had no difference in the six tastes, and not allowing her to eat anything that wasn't suitable.

source_sentence: 奇妙瓔珞以為嚴飾，譬如天女遊歡喜園，乃至未誕以來居止床座足不履地、目不觀惡色、耳不聽惡聲。
translation: They are adorned with exquisite jewelry, like a goddess who travels to the Garden of Joy even before her birth and lives on a quiet bed and seat with her feet not touching the ground, her eyes not observing bad colors, and her ears not hearing bad sounds.

source_sentence: 時經九月便誕一男，顏貌端正見者歡喜，身色如金頂圓若蓋，垂手過膝目若青蓮，額廣眉長鼻高修直。
translation: It's then that, after nine months, a man is born with a handsome face that's pleasing to the eye, a body the color of gold with a peak as round as a lid, hands that hang down past the knees, eyes like blue lotuses, and a broad forehead with long eyebrows and a nose that's high and straight.

source_sentence: 眾相圓滿人所稱歎，經三七日已集諸親族，商主以兒告諸親曰：『此兒今者當作何字？』
translation: After three or seven days, he gathered his relatives together, and the merchant told them, 'What will be the name of this child now?'

source_sentence: 眾共議曰：『此是商主師子之兒，可名師子胤。』
translation: The crowd agreed, 'This is the son of the merchant lord Shizi, who might be called Shizi Yin.'

source_sentence: 其父以兒授八乳母：二供乳哺、二作褓持、二為洗沐、二共歡戲。
translation: His father gave his son to eight nursing mothers: two to nurse, two to nurse, two to wash, and two to play together.

source_sentence: 此子既為八母供承無所乏少，常以乳酪、生酥、熟酥、醍醐，及餘上妙甘美飲食而用資養，速能長大如蓮出池。
translation: Since this son's eight mothers supported him without fail, he was always nourished with milk and cheese, fresh butter, refined butter, ghee, and other wonderful, sweet foods, and he quickly grew up like a lotus emerging from a pond.

source_sentence: 漸至童年學諸技藝、算數、書印，取與出納皆盡其妙，辯說開解智識聰明，於八種術善能瞻相，所謂男女、象馬、寶衣、木宅。
translation: As he gradually reaches childhood, he learns the arts, arithmetic, and calligraphy, fully perfects their skills in grasping and retrieving, and is intelligent in eloquence, enlightened in wisdom, and able to skillfully discern the characteristics of eight techniques, which are called "man and woman, elephant and horse, precious clothing, and wooden house.

source_sentence: 其父爾時於春夏冬，為造三殿并三苑園，置三婇女，謂上、中、下，昇妙樓觀奏諸伎樂而娛樂之。
translation: During spring, summer, and winter, his father builds three halls and three parks, places three concubines, which are called the superior, middle, and lower, and raises a marvelous tower to contemplate, play music, and entertain them.

source_sentence: 「商主師子，於日日中自知家務，日旰忘食。
translation: "The merchant lord Shizi knew his family's business day by day and forgot to eat every day.

source_sentence: 其子見父躬自勤勞，白言：『日晚何不時食？』
translation: When his son saw how hard his father worked, he said, 'Why don't you eat at sunset?'

source_sentence: 父便告曰：『豈常受樂辦家業耶？』
translation: Then his father told him, 'Does he always enjoy the pleasure of doing the family business?'

source_sentence: 子聞此語作如是念：『我父年尊自知家務，寧得閑縱貪為逸樂，宜自經求以濟生業。』
translation: When the son heard this, he thought, 'My father is old enough to know the work of the household, so he'd better pursue leisure and pleasure; he should seek his own livelihood to help.'

source_sentence: 即白父言：『口腹之重須自馳求，坐食父財是事不可。
translation: He then said to his father, 'You must search for the weight of your mouth and stomach, and sitting here eating your father's money is not an option.

source_sentence: 我今欲往入大海中求覓珍寶。』
translation: Now, I want to go into the ocean and search for treasures.'

source_sentence: 父告子曰：『汝今不應辛苦自作馳求，今我庫藏中多有財物，金銀寶貨隨汝受用。
translation: The father told his son, 'Now, you shouldn't work so hard to search for yourself; now, I have a lot of property in my treasury, and I'll give you gold, silver, and precious goods to use as you like.

source_sentence: 假使日日費用米麥亦不能盡，乃至我存任情取用，我過世後隨意經求。』
translation: Even if you were to spend more than enough on rice and wheat day by day, you wouldn't be able to use it as you like even if I were to store it, and I'll do as I please with my scrip after I pass away.'

source_sentence: 子頻啟父：『我欲汎舶暫至寶洲。』
translation: The son frequently asked his father, 'I want to sail across the ocean to the precious continent for a while.'

source_sentence: 父見慇懃從其所願，告言：『隨汝意去，可於苦事當忍受之。』
translation: Seeing his solicitude and complying with his wish, the father told him, 'Go as you wish, but you will endure this painful situation.'

source_sentence: 其父即便擊鼓宣令，普告城邑遠近商客：『諸君當知！
translation: The father then beat the drum and announced the order, telling the merchants in the city and its vicinity, 'You must know this!

source_sentence: 欲求珍寶者可與商主師子胤同入大海，所在經過不輸稅直，海中貨物並當備辦。』
translation: Those who wish to seek treasures may go with the merchant Shizi Yin into the ocean, passing through without paying taxes or making deliveries, and the goods in the ocean will be ready.'

source_sentence: 時有五百商人，聞是告已集商主處共結行期。
translation: After hearing this, five hundred merchants gathered at the merchant lord's place to set a travel schedule.

source_sentence: 既知期已各辭父母告別親知，選擇吉辰將諸貨物，人擔馬負隨商主去，展轉城邑行至海濱。
translation: After they knew the time had passed, they each left their parents and said goodbye to their relatives, chose an auspicious time to bring their goods, carried them on their backs and horses, and followed the merchant to the seashore.

source_sentence: 商主遂以五百金錢雇船入海，并覓五人：一、能遠望，二、能鼓棹，三能修船，四、能潛泳，五、能執柁。
translation: The merchant then hired a boat for 500 coins and asked for five men: one who could look ahead, two who could row, three who could repair the boat, four who could swim underwater, and five who could hold the spar.

source_sentence: 于時柁師將欲舉帆普告商人曰：『大海之中厄難非一、或猛風卒起漂泊山隅、或鯨鱗鋸牙穿舶沈沒。
translation: When the totem master was about to hoist the sail, he told the merchant, 'There's no one in the ocean who isn't in trouble; sometimes a fierce wind suddenly arises and the ship drifts off a mountain, or a whale's scales and teeth saw through the ship and sinks it.

source_sentence: 君等不應於急難時無所憑據，宜將浮物各自防身。』
translation: You shouldn't be left without a basis in times of trouble; it's better to protect yourselves with floating things.'

source_sentence: 時諸商人聞斯告已共相謂曰：『大海安危難可預識，我等宜應隨柁師語。』
translation: After hearing this advice, the merchants all said to each other, 'The safety of the ocean is difficult to foresee, so we should follow the words of Totemaster.'

source_sentence: 各求浮物以自防身，或將版木或持皮囊，或浮瓠等俱至舶所。
translation: Each of them sought something floating to protect himself, and some brought a plank, a leather bag, or a floating gourd to the ship.

source_sentence: 「既入大海，遇摩竭大魚碎破船舶。
translation: "When they entered the ocean, they ran into a large fish named Maghā that broke the ship.

source_sentence: 時諸人眾各憑浮物出沒隨波，宿業緣運餘命未盡，遇值北風漂泊南岸至赤銅洲，彼有眾多鳴鶴羅剎女在此居住。
translation: Each of those people then relies on something floating to get out and follow the waves, and before their remaining lives are up, they encounter a northerly wind that sends them adrift on the southern shore to the island of Chiliocosm, where many songbirds and rāṣṇas live.

source_sentence: 時羅剎女隨樂變形，若見破落商人能作美言詐為誘誑，於其城上竪二幢幡：一名慶喜，一名恐畏。
translation: When they see a ragtag merchant who speaks well of him and fraudulently entices him, the Rāṣṭrapāla women erect two banners above their city: one that rejoices, and one that terrifies.

source_sentence: 此幡若動表吉凶相，商人既至慶喜幡動。
translation: When this banner moves, it indicates good and bad fortune, and when the merchant arrives, the banner of joy moves.

source_sentence: 諸女議曰：『今吉幡動可往海濱，定有贍部洲人漂落至此。』
translation: The women said, 'Now that the banner of good fortune has moved, we can go to the seashore; surely someone from Jambudvīpa will drift down here.'

source_sentence: 即便化作美女容儀，俱行海際彷徉四顧，見有諸人憑託浮物而至於岸。
translation: They then took on the appearance of beautiful women and wandered out to sea, looking around and seeing people who had reached the shore on something floating.

source_sentence: 諸女各各化為瓔珞莊嚴其身，持上供具告諸人曰：『善來賢首！
translation: Each of the women transformed into a necklace to adorn her body, held up an offering, and told the others, 'Well done, good man!

source_sentence: 漂泊洪波極受辛苦，宜應就我居宅共解疲勞。』
translation: You've been wandering through torrents of trouble, so it's a good idea to go to my home and relieve your fatigue together.'

source_sentence: 時此城內先有漂泊商人，皆收置鐵城漸取充食，即便共諸商人相隨詣宅。
translation: When there were merchants wandering in this city, they all gathered in the iron city and gradually gathered enough food to eat, and then they followed the merchants to their homes.

source_sentence: 諸女告曰：『堂宇衣服諸有所須隨意受用，又我無夫，今依汝活，願為儔匹情無間然，多諸苑園皆可愛樂。』
translation: The women told them, 'I don't have a husband, so now I'm depending on you to live, and I hope you'll be a companion with whom there's no gap between lovers and many parks that are enjoyable.'

source_sentence: 又指庫藏：『此是贍部洲中所須寶物，金銀、琉璃、真珠、末尼、車渠、碼碯、珂貝、璧玉、赤珠、右旋，如斯等物亦隨意取用，與我歡居勿生疑慮，然此城南不宜輒往。』」
translation: He also pointed to the treasury, 'These are the treasures needed in Jambudvīpa, gold and silver, emeralds, real pearls, maniya, kaṭukhā, agates, khāsī, jade, red pearls, and rhodopsā, and such things are yours to take as you like.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告諸苾芻曰：「我不見有一事迷醉世間可愛可樂貪染繫縛過女色者，當知女人是能沈溺一切男子。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks, "I don't see anyone who's intoxicated by worldly desires and pleasures, and who's addicted, defiled, and bound to the female form, and you should know that women are capable of sinking all men.

source_sentence: 若諸男子見女人時，即便迷悶荒婬失志，於所作事皆忘次緒，勝妙善品不復存心。
translation: When men see a woman, they become confused, desolate, and disillusioned, forget about the sequential nature of what they're doing, and don't keep their minds on the excellent and good qualities anymore.

source_sentence: 是故苾芻！
translation: Therefore, monks!

source_sentence: 求解脫者，當勤修習離欲之行，於諸染境作不淨觀，如是應學。
translation: Those who seek liberation should diligently cultivate the practice of seclusion from desire and conduct an impure observation of defiled objects, and they should train in this way.

source_sentence: 「時彼商人便與羅剎女歡娛讌樂積有歲時，皆生一子復生一女。
translation: "That merchant then spent years of pleasure and music with the Rāṣṭrapāla women, each of whom gave birth to a son and a daughter.

source_sentence: 時商主師子胤作如是念：『何意諸女於城南路不許人行？
translation: The merchant lioness Yin then had this thought, 'Why don't you allow people to walk among the women on the south side of the city?'

source_sentence: 我宜候妻中宵睡熟，抽身徐起拔劍南行觀其所以。』
translation: I should wait until my wife is asleep at midnight, then I should get up slowly, draw my sword, and go south to observe what's going on.'

source_sentence: 即如所念夜起南行，聞有眾人悲啼號叫，而云：『苦哉贍部洲！
translation: Just as I had thought, I got up at night and traveled south, and I heard crowds of people wailing and shouting, saying, 'Oh, the misery of Jambudvīpa!'

source_sentence: 痛哉父母兄弟！』
translation: Woe to our parents and brothers!'

source_sentence: 是時商主聞其聲已，便大驚怖身毛皆竪。
translation: When the merchant heard his voice, he was terrified, and his hair stood on end.

source_sentence: 次更前行見大鐵城，高聳牢固周迴求覓竟無門戶，亦不見有人畜蹤跡，於此城北有尸利沙樹高出城隅。
translation: The next time he went further, he saw a large iron city that was high and solid, and when he looked around for it, there was no gate, and he saw no sign of people or animals.

source_sentence: 商主登上見城中人，遙問之曰：『汝何人哉？
translation: The merchant ascended and saw the man in the city, and he asked him from a distance, 'Who are you?'

source_sentence: 號哭於此念贍部洲父母兄弟。』
translation: They wailed, 'Remembering our parents and brothers from Jambudvīpa.'

source_sentence: 彼皆告言：『我是贍部洲人入海取寶，當昇舶之日恐遭海難，各持版木及以浮囊為護自身，望免其厄。
translation: They all told him, 'I'm a man from Jambudvīpa who went into the ocean to retrieve treasure. On the day we ascended to sea, we were afraid we'd be shipwrecked, so we each took a wooden board and protected ourselves with a flotation bag, hoping to avoid bad luck.

source_sentence: 既入大海被摩竭魚觸破我船，控告無路各持囊版隨風漂泊，業命未盡吹至南岸。
translation: After entering the ocean and being hit by a makara fish that had broken through our ship, we were accused of having no way out, so we each carried a bag and board and drifted with the wind, and our lives were not yet ended when we were blown to the south shore.

source_sentence: 時有眾女儀貌殊絕，齎持供養來至我所作如是言：「善來賢首！
translation: Then, a group of women with extraordinary appearance and bearing offerings came to us and said, "Well done, good man!

source_sentence: 我無歸趣以汝為夫，所有舍宅衣服飲食，七寶珍奇皆隨意用，廣說如前，乃至勿生疑慮。」
translation: I have no intention of taking you as my husband, so I'll use the house, clothing, food, and seven treasures as I like, as explained in detail above, and don't even have doubts about it."

source_sentence: 仍告我等：「於此城南無宜輒往，同居歡讌。」
translation: He also told us, "There's no time to go to the south of this city and live together in joy and pleasure."

source_sentence: 積有歲時，各於己妻皆生一子復生一女。
translation: After a certain number of years had passed, each of his wives gave birth to a son and a daughter.

source_sentence: 時彼諸女人見吉幡動，知有贍部洲人舶破而至，即捉我輩隨次食之，餘未食者置鐵城內。
translation: When those women saw the auspicious banners move, they knew there were people from Jambudvīpa who had arrived by sea, so they took our group and ate them in order, while the others who hadn't eaten were placed inside the iron city.

source_sentence: 當食之時現羅剎像，儀容可畏長爪鋸牙爴裂人體，餐噉血肉髮爪筋骨無有孑遺，乃至渧血墮地以指挑取并土吞之。
translation: When they eat them, they'll appear like a rāṣṇa with a fearsome appearance, long claws, serrated teeth, and a sword that splits open a person's body, eats flesh and blood, and leaves nothing behind, even when a drop of blood falls to the ground, picks it up with its fingers, and swallows it.

source_sentence: 我次未至處鐵城內每日食一，彼諸女者非是人類，皆是羅剎。
translation: The next place I went was inside the Iron City, where they eat one woman a day who isn't human but is a Rāṣṭrapāla.

source_sentence: 君等宜應善自防衛，不久亦當還遭此禍。』
translation: You should guard yourselves well, for it won't be long before you'll be subject to this misfortune again.'

source_sentence: 是時商主聞斯語已便大驚怖，告彼人曰：『頗有方便仁及我曹免斯苦厄，平安吉達還贍部洲不？』
translation: When the merchant heard those words, he became terrified and told the others, 'Could it be that there are some good men and women who will save us from this misfortune and return to Jambudvīpa in safety and fortune?'

source_sentence: 彼便告曰：『我無方便可得還至贍部洲中重見鄉國。
translation: He then told them, 'There's no way for me to go back to Jambudvīpa and see my country again.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 我知業重求脫無緣，我等共念穿鐵城下令作孔穴，欲求逃難冀免縶縛，其城即便更寬數倍。
translation: Knowing the seriousness of our actions and the lack of a way to escape, we shared the thought that we'd be forced to pierce an iron fortress and make a hole in it, hoping to escape and avoid being fettered, even though the fortress was several times wider.

source_sentence: 復欲踰越而出城遂增高，故知我等無緣得脫，以待命終。
translation: We then wanted to cross over and leave the city, and it grew taller, so we knew there was no way we could escape and were waiting for our lives to end.

source_sentence: 君等可有方便得還鄉國。』
translation: Do you have a way to return to your homeland?'

source_sentence: 商主問曰：『其事云何？』
translation: The merchant asked, 'What's the matter?'

source_sentence: 彼便告曰：『我比曾聞，於十五日褒灑陀時，於虛空中有諸天人作如是語：「贍部洲人！
translation: He then told them, 'I've heard that on the fifteenth day when Kośāda was alive, there were gods and humans in the sky who said, "Jambudvīpa!

source_sentence: 汝無智慧故守愚癡，於十五日褒灑陀時，不解北行尋求出路。
translation: Because you lack wisdom, you'll remain foolish and not understand how to travel northward on the fifteenth day when you're praising Sāta.

source_sentence: 每十五日有天馬王名婆羅訶，從海而出遊在岸邊，食自然香稻無病充溢有大力勢，舉首四顧如是三告：『誰有欲向彼岸還贍部洲？』」
translation: Every fifteenth day, a celestial horse king named Bālāha emerges from the sea and wanders onto the shore, eats naturally fragrant rice, has no illness, is overflowing with energy, raises his head and looks around like this three times, and says, 'Who wants to go back to Jambudvīpa on the other side?'"

source_sentence: 君等宜應於十五日褒灑陀時，於城北邊大海之際至天馬所，待馬語時即便告言：「我等欲歸彼岸還贍部洲，願見提携安隱而去。」
translation: You should go to the celestial horse at the ocean's edge to the north of the city on the fifteenth day of the festival, and when the horse speaks, you should tell it, "We want to return to the other shore and Jambudvīpa, so we'd like to see it brought up and left in peace."

source_sentence: 馬所陳語君當奉行。

source_sentence: 時師子胤商主聞彼說已，深心奉持讚歎希有，即便下樹尋路歸還依舊而臥。
translation: After hearing what they told him, the merchant Shizi Yin profoundly desired and praised him as rare, so he descended from the tree, found his way back, and returned to his old bed.

source_sentence: 「至天曉已詣彼五百商人之所，而告之曰：『君等宜可俱集某園，須有籌議，所有妻子並勿隨身。』
translation: "When sunrise arrived, he went to those five hundred merchants and told them, 'It's a good idea for you all to gather at a certain park, so we need to have a plan; don't take your wives with you.'

source_sentence: 時諸商人聞商主語，於一園中並皆俱集，商主即便具以上事普告眾人，復更告曰：『此等諸女皆是羅剎，君等宜應謹自防護。』
translation: When the merchants heard what the merchant said, they all gathered in one park, and the merchant then did all of the above and told them all, 'These women are all rājas, so you should guard yourselves.'
